name: National Museum of Natural Science
intro:
The National Museum of Natural Science's mission is: "以人為本：結合博物館專業與社會資源，提昇民眾科學與文化素養，建構永續發展的社會。", which translates to "People-oriented: Combining museum expertise and social resources to enhance the public's scientific and cultural literacy and build a sustainable society."
			
End of process

name: National Taichung Theater
intro:
National Taichung Theater (NTT) is a public performing arts center located in Xitun District, Taichung City, Taiwan. Designed by Japanese architect Toyo Ito, the building is based on the concept of "Sound Cave" and took five years to build. It began trial operation on November 23, 2014, and officially opened on August 26, 2016. Its complex structure and high construction difficulty have earned it the reputation of being "the most difficult house to build in the world."
			
End of process

name: National Taiwan Museum of Fine Arts
intro:
The National Taiwan Museum of Fine Arts (NTMOFA) is a national-level museum in Taichung, Taiwan. It is dedicated to the collection, research, preservation, and exhibition of Taiwanese and international modern and contemporary art. The museum is open from Tuesday to Friday, 09:00-17:00, and Saturday to Sunday, 09:00-18:00. It is closed on Mondays and during the Lunar New Year holidays. The address is No.2, Sec.1, Wuquan West Road, Taichung, Taiwan 40359. The telephone number is +886-4-2372-3552.
			
End of process

name: Miyahara Ophthalmology
intro:
Miyahara Ophthalmology is a popular ice cream shop located in a historical building in Taichung, near the Taichung Train Station. It offers various flavored ice creams and has a restaurant. It was originally an eye clinic built by a Japanese ophthalmologist.
			
End of process

name: Taichung Park
intro:
['The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.']
Taichung Park, also known as Zhongshan Park, is located in the heart of Taichung City. It was built in 1903, during the period of Japanese rule, and was originally called Taichung Zhongshan Park. The park covers an area of about 10 hectares and is the oldest park in Taichung City. The park is a combination of traditional Chinese and Japanese garden design, with a lake, pavilions, bridges, and various plants and flowers. It is a popular place for locals and tourists to relax and enjoy the scenery. Key features include日月湖, 更樓, 中正橋, 藝閣亭, 望月亭, 湖心亭, and 放送電台.
			
End of process
